title: Drawing, "Project for the Painted Decoration of a Wall, with Alternate Suggestions", 1835–50
medium: Brush and watercolor and graphite on white laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mary Hearn Greims
description: A dado is at the bottom, a high entablature with a colored ovolo at the bottom, on top. For the panel are suggested horizontal rows of discs with leaf boughs in the wedges, in the lower part of the design horizontal alternate rows of circles and wreaths, respectively. The neighboring motifs are to be intertwined. Bough rosettes are in the centers. Framing similar to 1940-120-9.

exhibitions.title: Multiple Choice: From Sample to Product

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for the Painted Decoration of a Wall, with Alternate Suggestions", 1835–50.
1835–50. Brush and watercolor and graphite on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mary Hearn Greims. 1940-120-68.
